intro: Nonea pulchella, commonly known as the pretty bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. Nonea pulchella is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
